<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LABOR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/11/gig-economy-hits-road-bump-405?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Gig Economy Hits a Road Bump on the 405
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Gig Economy Hits a Road Bump on the 405" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l23bLAL11mp3kAhUJY/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Gig Economy Hits a Road Bump on the 405" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l23bLAL11mp3kAhUJY/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy/<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7CVfTd-_qbc" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Movieclips</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The tech-fueled gig economy is confronting one of its <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/11/technology/california-gig-economy-bill.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest obstacles</a> yet, and it's not your 2.3-star rating. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, California’s state legislature <a href="https://www.sfchronicle.com/business/article/Senate-passes-AB5-gig-work-bill-turning-14430204.php?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">passed a bill</a> that would force gig-economy companies to reclassify their independent contractors as employees. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What that means:</strong></span><span> “Employee” status gives workers rights to benefits like a minimum wage and unemployment insurance. The measure would affect at least 1 million workers in California.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The bill has sparked a heated debate </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Particularly over the consequences of tech’s influence on labor. Companies like Uber, Lyft, and DoorDash work with contractors who <em>seem</em> an awful lot like employees—in the sense that drivers and delivery workers perform those businesses’ core functions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who’s for the bill:</strong> ...gig workers, unions, and legislators who sneer at tech companies’ big talk about disruption, innovation, and hoodies at work. “There’s nothing innovative about underpaying someone for their labor,” said one of the bill’s co-authors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who’s against:</strong> Again, no shockers here. Uber and Lyft say contracting gives workers flexibility, and labeling them employees could kill their businesses. They’re lobbying for exemptions to the bill and might try to get around it via ballot initiative. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Uber struck an even more defiant tone yesterday, when its chief legal officer said the company </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/11/business/economy/uber-california-bill.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wouldn’t reclassify its drivers</a></span><span> under the proposed rules.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The bigger picture</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Vox <a href="https://www.vox.com/2019/9/11/20851034/california-ab-5-workers-labor-unions?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">argues</a> that this bill is a broader win for the U.S. labor movement. Janitors, construction workers, and security guards will get spots on payrolls they’ve been denied in the past. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That movement hasn’t seen many victories in the past few decades, and this one is all the more significant because of California’s vast economy and influence. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead..</strong>the bill is headed to the desk of Gov. Gavin Newsom, who has said he plans to sign it. If/when it gets the nod, it will go into effect on Jan. 1, 2020. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/11/purdue-pharma-tentatively-agreed-settlement-opioid-crisis?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Purdue You Think This Is Over Yet?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Purdue Pharma and its owners, the Sackler family, have <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/purdue-pharma-close-to-settlement-with-cities-and-half-of-states-over-opioid-crisis-11568224310?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reportedly reached</a> a tentative settlement worth <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-purdue-pharma-opioids-settlement-excl/exclusive-purdue-pharma-nears-partial-opioid-settlement-bankruptcy-filing-sources-idUSKCN1VW292?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up to $12 billion</a> with 23 states, three U.S. territories, and lawyers for the thousands of municipal governments and Native American tribes suing the company for its <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/purdue-pharma-reaches-tentative-settlement-in-federal-lawsuit-and-some-state-litigation/2019/09/11/ce6cb942-d4b8-11e9-9343-40db57cf6abd_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">alleged role</a> in the opioid crisis.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The settlement doesn't involve an admission of wrongdoing. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The deal could resolve a huge chunk of planned litigation against Purdue by sending the OxyContin maker into Chapter 11 bankruptcy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What else (likely) changes for Purdue:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Purdue Pharma will restructure as a new company that will still sell OxyContin but siphon off profits to pay plaintiffs. It’ll be the TikTok to the old Purdue’s Vine.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Purdue will donate “rescue” drugs it’s developing to treat addiction and stop overdoses.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And as for the Sackler family...</strong>it’ll pay <a href="https://www.npr.org/2019/09/09/758927743/sacklers-reject-demand-they-surrender-personal-wealth-to-settle-opioid-claims?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">at least $3 billion</a> in cash and exit the company. But we’d bet their $13 billion fortune this isn’t over for the Sacklers. The settlement was a disappointment for some state AGs—and Virginia, New Mexico, and Delaware have filed cases against individual Sackler family members to keep the litigious fires burning.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/11/hong-kong-stock-exchange-wants-buy-londons?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
To the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, London Is Perfect
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTA3LzEyMDBweC1wYXRlcm5vc3Rlcl9zcXVhcmVfanBnLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Paternoster Square in London</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While you were sleeping Tuesday night, Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing (or HKEX) made an unsolicited $36.6 billion offer <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/11/business/hong-kong-london-stock-exchange.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to acquire</a> the London Stock Exchange.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">HKEX’s idea of a big picture:</strong> The exchanges have a combined market value of over <a href="https://qz.com/1707136/hong-kongs-attempted-buyout-of-london-stock-exchange-is-the-boldest-deal-ever/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$70 billion</a>, together topping the price tag on the $50 billion Intercontinental Exchange, the NYSE’s parent company.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the picture is bigger than just London and Hong Kong. The potential tie-in reminds us just how intertwined the world’s trading hubs have become as technological advancements take finance cross-border.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>HKEX bought the London Metal Exchange’s parent company in 2012.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Germany’s Deutsche Börse Group has </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/hong-kong-stock-exchange-makes-36-56-billion-bid-for-london-stock-exchange-11568193034?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tried twice</a></span><span> and failed twice to buy the LSE. The U.S.-based Nasdaq also made a run for it...unsuccessfully.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Nasdaq </span><span><a href="https://business.nasdaq.com/discover/nasdaq-story/our-businesses?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">owns and operates</a></span><span> exchanges in the Nordic and Baltic regions, where day traders barely work in the winter. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The LSE has proven difficult to tie down. Its <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/29/london-stock-talks-buy-refinitiv?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recent bid</a> for Refinitiv won’t make things easier...and LSE chief David Schwimmer (not that David Schwimmer) <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/d53ae238-d46f-11e9-8367-807ebd53ab77?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called the deal</a> “preliminary and highly conditional.”</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
OBIT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/11/energy-mogul-t-boone-pickens-died?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Energy Mogul T. Boone Pickens Has Died
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Corporate raider, oil and gas exec, and hedge fund magnate T. Boone Pickens <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/11/t-boone-pickens-oracle-of-oil-and-corporate-raider-dies-at-91.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">died</a> yesterday of natural causes at 91.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That’s a heckuva résumé.</strong> After starting out in oil and gas, Pickens started his own firm, Mesa Petroleum, in 1956. The NYT <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/20/business/t-boone-pickens.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">described</a> him as “Gordon Gekko before <em>Wall Street</em>” when he retired last year.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>His net worth would eventually </span><span><a href="https://www.forbes.com/profile/t-boone-pickens/#789ec9f8a90e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reach $1.2 billion</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 1996 at age 68, Pickens declared it was “<a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/tboonepickens/2017/09/19/you-can-be-successful-if-you-have-a-plan/#465626c41975?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">halftime</a>.” He sold Mesa and started BP Capital Management, a hedge fund focused on energy investments.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That’s BP for Boone Pickens. He definitely enjoyed putting his name on things...the next year, he started Pickens Fuel Corp., a natural gas company. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pickens also had a taste for conservative politics, supporting Republican candidates including George W. Bush, Rudy Giuliani, and Donald Trump. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Pickens’s legacy:</strong> Pickens is remembered for his advocacy for U.S. energy independence and shareholder <span>rights</span> as well as his <a href="https://okstate.com/sports/2015/6/18/GEN_0618155302.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">contributions</a> to Oklahoma State University, where they play football at...you guessed it, Boone Pickens Stadium.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BOOK REC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/11/nir-eyal-wants-get-back-track?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Nir Eyal Wants You to Get Back on Track
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Nir Eyal Wants You to Get Back on Track" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY4MjMyNDQzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Nir Eyal</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Did you check Instagram five times before getting to this part of the newsletter? We’ve got the book for you. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Behavioral design expert Nir Eyal wrote the <a href="http://geni.us/hooked?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">definitive guide</a> on how companies like YouTube sink you down a rabbit hole of kitten videos and keep you coming back for more. So who better to write a follow-up on pulling yourself out of the abyss?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He’s back this week with <a href="http://geni.us/Indistractable?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Indistractable</em></a>, a guide on action for traction in a world of distraction.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whatever pulls you away from what you want to be doing is a distraction. That could be Netflix...or it could be your boss. It’s easy to blame the internet for how scatterbrained we’ve become, but Eyal thinks technology isn’t the only villain. He’s got some tips on how to Skinner Box your tech habits and stop lying to yourself.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Read the full interview <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/11/conversation-indistractable-author-nir-eyal?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Morning Brew bonus! </strong><a href="https://www.nirandfar.com/morningbrew/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Order<em> Indistractable</em> through this link</a> by Sunday and you’ll receive an <em>exclusive video course</em> and extra resources to help you get more done than you ever thought possible.</p>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nGig Economy Hits a Road Bump on the 405\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Gig Economy Hits a Road Bump on the 405\" !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Gig Economy Hits a Road Bump on the 405\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/l23bLAL11mp3kAhUJY/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy/\u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7CVfTd-_qbc\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMovieclips\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe tech-fueled gig economy is confronting one of its \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/11/technology/california-gig-economy-bill.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest obstacles\u003c/a\u003e yet, and it's not your 2.3-star rating. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis week, California’s state legislature \u003ca href=\"https://www.sfchronicle.com/business/article/Senate-passes-AB5-gig-work-bill-turning-14430204.php?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epassed a bill\u003c/a\u003e that would force gig-economy companies to reclassify their independent contractors as employees. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that means:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e “Employee” status gives workers rights to benefits like a minimum wage and unemployment insurance. The measure would affect at least 1 million workers in California.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe bill has sparked a heated debate \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eParticularly over the consequences of tech’s influence on labor. Companies like Uber, Lyft, and DoorDash work with contractors who \u003cem\u003eseem\u003c/em\u003e an awful lot like employees—in the sense that drivers and delivery workers perform those businesses’ core functions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho’s for the bill:\u003c/strong\u003e ...gig workers, unions, and legislators who sneer at tech companies’ big talk about disruption, innovation, and hoodies at work. “There’s nothing innovative about underpaying someone for their labor,” said one of the bill’s co-authors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho’s against:\u003c/strong\u003e Again, no shockers here. Uber and Lyft say contracting gives workers flexibility, and labeling them employees could kill their businesses. They’re lobbying for exemptions to the bill and might try to get around it via ballot initiative. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eUber struck an even more defiant tone yesterday, when its chief legal officer said the company \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/11/business/economy/uber-california-bill.html?action=click\u0026module=Top%20Stories\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewouldn’t reclassify its drivers\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e under the proposed rules.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe bigger picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eVox \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2019/9/11/20851034/california-ab-5-workers-labor-unions?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eargues\u003c/a\u003e that this bill is a broader win for the U.S. labor movement. Janitors, construction workers, and security guards will get spots on payrolls they’ve been denied in the past. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat movement hasn’t seen many victories in the past few decades, and this one is all the more significant because of California’s vast economy and influence. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead..\u003c/strong\u003ethe bill is headed to the desk of Gov. Gavin Newsom, who has said he plans to sign it. If/when it gets the nod, it will go into effect on Jan. 1, 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePurdue Pharma and its owners, the Sackler family, have \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/purdue-pharma-close-to-settlement-with-cities-and-half-of-states-over-opioid-crisis-11568224310?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereportedly reached\u003c/a\u003e a tentative settlement worth \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-purdue-pharma-opioids-settlement-excl/exclusive-purdue-pharma-nears-partial-opioid-settlement-bankruptcy-filing-sources-idUSKCN1VW292?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup to $12 billion\u003c/a\u003e with 23 states, three U.S. territories, and lawyers for the thousands of municipal governments and Native American tribes suing the company for its \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/purdue-pharma-reaches-tentative-settlement-in-federal-lawsuit-and-some-state-litigation/2019/09/11/ce6cb942-d4b8-11e9-9343-40db57cf6abd_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealleged role\u003c/a\u003e in the opioid crisis.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe settlement doesn't involve an admission of wrongdoing. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe deal could resolve a huge chunk of planned litigation against Purdue by sending the OxyContin maker into Chapter 11 bankruptcy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat else (likely) changes for Purdue:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePurdue Pharma will restructure as a new company that will still sell OxyContin but siphon off profits to pay plaintiffs. It’ll be the TikTok to the old Purdue’s Vine.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePurdue will donate “rescue” drugs it’s developing to treat addiction and stop overdoses.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd as for the Sackler family...\u003c/strong\u003eit’ll pay \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2019/09/09/758927743/sacklers-reject-demand-they-surrender-personal-wealth-to-settle-opioid-claims?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eat least $3 billion\u003c/a\u003e in cash and exit the company. But we’d bet their $13 billion fortune this isn’t over for the Sacklers. The settlement was a disappointment for some state AGs—and Virginia, New Mexico, and Delaware have filed cases against individual Sackler family members to keep the litigious fires collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile you were sleeping Tuesday night, Hong Kong Exchanges \u0026 Clearing (or HKEX) made an unsolicited $36.6 billion offer \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/11/business/hong-kong-london-stock-exchange.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" Exchange.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHKEX’s idea of a big picture:\u003c/strong\u003e The exchanges have a combined market value of over \u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/1707136/hong-kongs-attempted-buyout-of-london-stock-exchange-is-the-boldest-deal-ever/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$70 billion\u003c/a\u003e, together topping the price tag on the $50 billion Intercontinental Exchange, the NYSE’s parent company.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the picture is bigger than just London and Hong Kong. The potential tie-in reminds us just how intertwined the world’s trading hubs have become as technological advancements take finance cross-border.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHKEX bought the London Metal Exchange’s parent company in 2012.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eGermany’s Deutsche Börse Group has \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/hong-kong-stock-exchange-makes-36-56-billion-bid-for-london-stock-exchange-11568193034?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etried twice\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and failed twice to buy the LSE. The U.S.-based Nasdaq also made a run for it...unsuccessfully.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNasdaq \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://business.nasdaq.com/discover/nasdaq-story/our-businesses?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eowns and operates\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e exchanges in the Nordic and Baltic regions, where day traders barely work in the winter. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe LSE has proven difficult to tie down. Its \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/29/london-stock-talks-buy-refinitiv?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecent bid\u003c/a\u003e for Refinitiv won’t make things easier...and LSE chief David Schwimmer (not that David Schwimmer) \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/d53ae238-d46f-11e9-8367-807ebd53ab77?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalled the deal\u003c/a\u003e “preliminary and highly conditional.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F09%2F11%2Fhong-kong-stock-exchange-wants-buy-londons\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Boone Pickens Has Died\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCorporate raider, oil and gas exec, and hedge fund magnate T. Boone Pickens \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/11/t-boone-pickens-oracle-of-oil-and-corporate-raider-dies-at-91.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edied\u003c/a\u003e yesterday of natural causes at 91.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThat’s a heckuva résumé.\u003c/strong\u003e After starting out in oil and gas, Pickens started his own firm, Mesa Petroleum, in 1956. The NYT \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/20/business/t-boone-pickens.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edescribed\u003c/a\u003e him as “Gordon Gekko before \u003cem\u003eWall Street\u003c/em\u003e” when he retired last year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHis net worth would eventually \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/profile/t-boone-pickens/#789ec9f8a90e?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereach $1.2 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 1996 at age 68, Pickens declared it was “\u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/tboonepickens/2017/09/19/you-can-be-successful-if-you-have-a-plan/#465626c41975?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehalftime\u003c/a\u003e.” He sold Mesa and started BP Capital Management, a hedge fund focused on energy investments.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat’s BP for Boone Pickens. He definitely enjoyed putting his name on things...the next year, he started Pickens Fuel Corp., a natural gas company. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePickens also had a taste for conservative politics, supporting Republican candidates including George W. Bush, Rudy Giuliani, and Donald Trump. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePickens’s legacy:\u003c/strong\u003e Pickens is remembered for his advocacy for U.S. energy independence and shareholder \u003cspan\u003erights\u003c/span\u003e as well as his \u003ca href=\"https://okstate.com/sports/2015/6/18/GEN_0618155302.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtributions\u003c/a\u003e to Oklahoma State University, where they play football at...you guessed it, Boone Pickens Stadium.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!--
